Postings.Text:
Correction: Andre Greipel's 11th day as a leader of the SANTOS Tour Down is a record, but it's record he's held since he claimed it for the 8th time (stage 5) in 2010.

On that day-around McLaren Vale & Willunga, Greipel overtook the previous record holder Fabbio Sacchi who from 2001 to 2003 enjoyed seven days as the race leader.

One of the riders in today's break, Thomas de Gendt (BEL) - VCD was asked to sum up his day? “ I don’t know if there was a gap or not, so I am waiting to see the results but I wanted to go on the attack” “Three of the four riders had the same goal and that was to take the second sprint and then after that we just wanted to go back to the peloton.” “The legs are not so good but I will try to attack. I think tomorrow is the best for me just to stay in the peloton and then Old Willunga Hill is going to be so hard but I am going to try and be in the front.”

After the stage Cycle Instead Young Rider Classification leader Michael Matthews (AUS) - RAB was asked how he was feeling? “A bit disappointed. The boys had a really good lead out for me and I just couldn’t really hold the wheel in the last couple of kilometres. It just got a bit messy and Mark Renshaw [Rabobank] held the lead out but yeah I just wasn’t there to finish it.”

Stage winner's time: 3:21:55
Stage speed: 40kmh
Average race speed: 36.3kmh

Official Overall SKODA KOM classification: 1: Thomas de Gendt (BEL) - VCD 12 pts. 2: William Clarke (AUS - Tas) - UNA 10 pts. 3: Martin Kohler (SUI) - BMC 8pts. 4: Matthew Brammeier (IRL) - OPQ 6pts. 5: Jan Bakelants (BEL) - RNT 4pts. 6: Tiago Machado (POR) - RNT 4pts.
Cycle Instead Young Rider: 1: Michael Matthews (AUS) - RAB 2: Edvald Boasson Hagen (NOR) - SKY @0:04. 3:Rohan Dennis (AUS - SA) - UNA @ 0:05 4:Romain Lemarchand (FRA) - ALM @0:08

Official Results Jayco Sprint points: 1: Andre Greipel (GER) - LTB 30pts. 2:Yauheni Hutarovich (BLR) - FDJ 27pts. 3:Edvald Boasson Hagen (NOR) - SKY 24pts. 4:William Clarke (AUS - Tas) - UNA 21pts. 5:Martin Kohler (SUI) - BMC 20pts. 6:Daniele Bennati (ITA) - RNT 19pts 7:Mark Renshaw (AUS) - RAB 19pts.

Official General Classification after Stage 3 2012 SANTOS Tour Down Under. 1:Andre Greipel (GER) - LTB 2:Martin Kohler (SUI) - BMC @0:08 3:Michael Matthews (AUS) - RAB @0:12 4:Thomas de Gendt (BEL) - VCD @0:14 5:Simon Gerrans (AUS) - GEC @0:16 6:Jan Bakelants (BEL) - RNT @st 7:Edvald Boasson Hagen (NOR) - SKY " 8:Eduard Vorganov (RUS) - KAT " 9:Rohan Dennis (AUS - SA) - UNA @0:17 10:Xavier Florencio Cabre' (ESP) - KAT @0:20 Selected: 19: Michael Rogers (AUS) - SKY @0:20. 22: Alessandro Ballan (ITA) - BMC @st 28: Oscar Freire (ESP) - KAT @st 29: Alejandro Valverde (ESP) - MOV @st 38: Heinrich Haussler (AUS) - GRM @st 40: Luis Leon Sanchez (ESP) - RAB @st 41: Jose Joaquin Rojas (ESP) - MOV @st 52: Cameron Meyer (AUS) - GEC @st 57: Matthew Lloyd (AUS) - LAM @st 131:Boris Shpilevskiy (RUS) - ALM @23.08

Official results Stage 3 2012 SANTOS Tour Down Under: 1:Andre Greipel (GER) - LTB 2:Yauheni Hutarovich (BLR) - FDJ @ st 3:Edvald Boasson Hagen (NOR) - SKY " 4:Mark Renshaw (AUS) - RAB " 5:Robbie McEwen (AUS) - GEC " 6:Jacopo Guarnieri (ITA) - AST " 7:Heinrich Haussler (AUS) - GRM " 8:Daniele Bennati (ITA) - RNT " 9:Manuel Belletti (ITA) - ALM " 10:Christopher Sutton (AUS) - SKY " Selected: 121: Marcus Burghardt (GER) - BMC @st 122: Manuel Quinziato (ITA) - BMC @0:37 129: Stuart O'Grady (AUS) - GEC @3:00 130: Luke Durbridge (AUS) - GEC @st 131: Jos Van Emden (NED) - RAB "

Here's some of what Yauheni Hutarovich (BLR) - FDJ had to say after his 2nd place in today's stage 3 of the SANTOS Tour Down Under. “The first stage I was already third so that was a good sign and yesterday I took a journey and today had to recover and think about this stage. From the start I felt I had good legs so I gave it a go and it was good to be second.”

Attention now turns to the Barossa Valley, specifically Tanunda, where Greipel won in 2010; in fact he’s one of three Germans to triumph there.
Despite declaring that his Lotto-Belisol team has now achieved its objectives for the SANTOS Tour Down Under don’t be surprised if tomorrow Greipel exceeds them in the 138km BUPA Stage 4 from Norwood to Tanunda.

The high speeds ensured that no other riders were able to establish an attack, so we were set for a bunch sprint into what would be a technical and cross wind affected finish in Victor Harbor. Numerous riders punctured as the race approached Victor but when the sprinters finally got going, Greipel once again proved to be too strong beating Yauheni Hutarovich (BLR) - FDJ and Edvald Boasson Hagen (NOR) - SKY, with Mark Renshaw (AUS) - RAB in fourth.

Also there was Thomas de Gendt (BEL) - VCD who last year was in the same breakaway where Cameron Meyer (AUS) - GEC effectively won the TDU (Stage 4 into Strathalbyn). Meyer won that stage with DeGendt recording the same time in 2nd. So the lead was never allowed to break six minutes and when Matthew Brammeier (IRL) - OPQ was the final rider caught, only 92k’s had been ridden.

Four riders soon established a break. Eduard Vorganov (RUS) - KAT, Jan Bakelants (BEL) - RNT, Thomas de Gendt (BEL) - VCD and Matthew Brammeier (IRL) - OPQ contested the SKODA KOM (Sellicks Hill 42.9km , cat 2) ) and both the Jayco Sprints (Mt Compass 65km and Goolwa 70km) before they were caught. Unlike yesterday though the peloton never let this break get too far ahead because in Eduard Vorganov (RUS) - KAT and Jan Bakelants (BEL) - RNT they had two riders highly placed in the GC—(6th and 9th respectively).

Greipel now holds an eight second lead on GC over yesterday’s Ochre jersey winner Martin Kohler (SUI) - BMC. Michael Matthews (AUS) - RAB is third on 12 secs with Thomas de Gendt (BEL) - VCD (0:14) and Simon Gerrans (AUS) - GEC (0:16) 4th and 5th. The early stage of the race followed a predictable pattern with a small group of riders attacking as soon as the riders left the race neutral zone.

Greipel’s 10th stage win puts him only two behind current record holder Robbie McEwen (12) and erases bad memories of the stage to Victor in 2009 when he crashed and broke a collarbone.
 
Making today’s victory even more remarkable is that several of Greipel’s teammates are injured and in Jurgen Roelandt’s case, in hospital and out of the race.

Andre Greipel continues to dominate the 2012 SANTOS Tour Down Under, after winning the 134.5km stage three between Unley and Victor Harbor.
The powerful German recorded his second stage win (three if you count the Down Under Classic) to regain the Ochre Leaders jersey he held after Tuesday’s first stage.
Edvald Boasson Hagen (NOR) - SKY was one of many riders to puncture today in the run in to Victor Harbor.

A post race comment from Edvald Boasson Hagen (NOR) - SKY: "Nah I can’t blame the tyre for that. The team did a really great job and we have to try again and hopefully we get higher, getting better every day now, so maybe like .... so that we’ll be even higher up.”

Michael Matthews (AUS) - RAB has just tweeted: "The team rode awesome for me today I just wasnt good enough to hold @Mark_Renshaw wheel in the last 2 k not happy" Good to see Renshaw being the ultimate team player and trying to set up a win for his teammate when he could have easily been in contention himself.

Greipel:
"The Willunga stage is too hard for me to win GC this year. 
With two stage wins, we’ve already reached our goal. We can’t have everything and we just take it day by day.”

Greipel:
"I told my team-mates ‘I need to be on 5th or 6th position at that point’. 

"They did a great job to put me there and I finished it off. I’m happy to get back into the lead but the time bonus I got again isn’t important in my mind."

Greipel: 
"It was our intention to keep the breakaway in sight with a good gap. The crosswinds have made the race faster. The one kilometre to go mark was the most important point of today’s stage."

More from Andre Greipel the winner of stage 3 of the 2012 SANTOS Tour Down Under.
“This victory is for Jurgen Roelandts who unfortunately supports us from the hospital. We’re nearly three riders down but the rest of the team that is not injured has been awesome today. "

The jersey wearers for BUPA Stage 4 will be as follows: SANTOS Ochre Leaders Jersey: Andre Greipel (GER) - LTB Jayco Sprint Jersey: Yauheni Hutarovich (BLR) - FDJ (Greipel leads this classification but is wearing ochre) SKODA KOM: Thomas de Gendt (BEL) - VCD Cycle Instead Young rider: Michael Matthews (AUS) - RAB
Provisional Cycle Instead Young rider: Michael Matthews (AUS) - RAB Hindmarsh Most Aggressive jersey: Thomas de Gendt (BEL) - VCD

Provisional Overall SKODA KOM classification: 1: Thomas de Gendt (BEL) - VCD 12 pts. 2: William Clarke (AUS - Tas) - UNA 10 pts. 3: Martin Kohler (SUI) - BMC 8pts. 4: Matthew Brammeier (IRL) - OPQ 6pts. 5: Jan Bakelants (BEL) - RNT 4pts. 6: Tiago Machado (POR) - RNT 4pts.
Provisional Results Jayco Sprint point: 1: Andre Greipel (GER) - LTB 30pts. 2:Yauheni Hutarovich (BLR) - FDJ 27pts. 3:Edvald Boasson Hagen (NOR) - SKY 24pts. 4:William Clarke (AUS - Tas) - UNA 21pts.
